text:

03





Initialization of Arrays
 
Compile-time Initialization
Arrays can be initialized at compile time using specific values. Example:
int arr[5] = {10, 20, 30, 40, 50};
int arr[5] = {1, 2};   // arr = {1, 2, 0, 0, 0}
int arr[] = {1, 2, 3};   // size = 3 
 
Run-time Initialization
Arrays can also be initialized at run-time using scanf.
source: Arrays in C – A Complete Guide.pptx

Key Points to Remember
 
Key Points to Remember
Arrays are fixed size. 1
Stored in contiguous memory. 3
Visual: Icon-based summary. Index starts from 0.

Initialization of Arrays
 
Compile-time Initialization
Arrays can be initialized at compile time using specific values. Example:
int arr[5] = {10, 20, 30, 40, 50};
int arr[5] = {1, 2};   // arr = {1, 2, 0, 0, 0}
int arr[] = {1, 2, 3};   // size = 3 
 
Run-time Initialization
Arrays can also be initialized at run-time using scanf.
